snippet: Serafim Todorov does not resent Mayweather’s success since defeating him in the 1996 Olympic boxing semifinals. Rather, his bitterness stems from what happened in the final.
abstract: Serafim Todorov, last boxer to beat Floyd Mayweather Jr in 1996 Olympics, says the victory led to demise of his boxing career; after the fight, Todorov turned down a professional career offered to him by American promoters, who immediately turned to Mayweather; Todorov now lives in remote town in Bulgaria with his wife and two children.
lead_paragraph: Serafim Todorov does not resent Mayweather’s success since defeating him in the 1996 Olympic boxing semifinals. Rather, his bitterness stems from what happened in the final.

headline.main: He’s the Last Boxer to Beat Floyd Mayweather Jr., and He So Regrets It
headline.print_headline: He’s the Last Boxer to Beat Mayweather, and He So Regrets It
